page.title: 07KINGSWOOD PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: In Kingswood, the parish council meets at 7.15 sharp on one Monday a month at the old Abbey Gatehouse. They are the only people who use the Gatehouse apart from tourists. There are 7 parish councillors whose occupations include: housewives, a retired postmaster, a retired mill worker and farmers. The Parish Council has replaced all the old street lights in Kingswood . Each street light costs Â£368. They also employ people to do jobs: a lady cleans the bus shelters and one of the councillors cuts the grass. The Council have replaced two climbing frame feet and the benches round the village for people to sit on. These benches cost Â£80-Â£90. In Kingswood dogs are a problem because they foul the pavements. The Parish Councillors are very concerned about the mess and try to stop it happening.
